intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create a "Hello World" Lisaac application.
The application will print "Hello World" in the console when run. Enter Lisaac World!

item.title: Open the Lisaac perspective
item.description: If you're not already in a Lisaac perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Lisaac.

item.title: Create a Lisaac Project
item.description: We need a project to create an application. Click on the New Lisaac Project button, or click on the link below. Enter HelloWorld for the project name, then click Finish.

item.title: Create your HelloWorld Prototype
item.description: The next step is to create a new prototype. If the project wizard has not created a main prototype, click on the New Prototype button, select the checkbox to create the main slot.

item.title: Add a print statement
Run your Lisaac application
item.description:
To run your application, select Run-> Run configurations menu, select Lisaac Application. The Console view should appear at the bottom and display the "Hello, world!" output.
Congratulations! You have successfully created a Lisaac Hello World application!
